description:
Manages a LoadBalancer NAT Rule.

~> **NOTE** When using this resource, the LoadBalancer needs to have a FrontEnd IP Configuration Attached

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

BackendPort.description: The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Possible values range between 1 and 65535, inclusive.

EnableFloatingIp.description: Enables the Floating IP Capacity, required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group.

FrontendIpConfigurationName.description: The name of the frontend IP configuration exposing this rule.

FrontendPort.description: The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each Rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Possible values range between 1 and 65534, inclusive.

LoadbalancerId.description: The ID of the LoadBalancer in which to create the NAT Rule.

Name.description: Specifies the name of the NAT Rule.

Protocol.description: The transport protocol for the external endpoint. Possible values are `Udp` or `Tcp`.

ResourceGroupName.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the resource.
